instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesnâ€™t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN:
What is PCH_INTVRMEN? PCH_INTVRMEN is an Internal Voltage Regulator Enable: When pulled high, this signal enables
the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must
remain asserted for the VRMs to behave properly (no glitches allowed).
This signal must be pulled-up to VCCRTC on desktop platforms and may
optionally be pulled low on mobile platforms if using an external VR for the
VCCSUS rail.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message:
Hi all,
 This came with no any liquid damage. 

But broken cap <CAPACITOR>C5725</CAPACITOR>. initial issue is can't turn of after shutdown. Power Button works time to time. . power on when connect the charger and can shutdown pressing power button but can't turn on again.
 When this happen can't turn on even shorting power pads. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C5725</CAPACITOR> same be behaviour. disconnecting keyboard, pressing power pads it stops and restart.

Checked with known woring keyboard same issue. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v and pressing power button does to 0.4 for few seconds and back to 3.3v <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.V, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.3v  and <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> 0V. <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> get 3.3v 

I HAVE REPLACED <CAPACITOR>C5725</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U5725</CHIP>, SMC But no luck.


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message:
Here are the RTC rails.
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>:3.3V
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL>:3.0V
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN</SIGNAL>: 3.3V

Once shutdown from the power button. only can start by disconnect and connecting the charger. once boot all the keys are functioning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message:
Try the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, apart of an USB mouse.
Check if you can turn it off and on using power pads <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: board alone on the desk shrting power pads can turn on and when turn off it restarts my itself.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: If maintain <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> low for 4-5s, remains off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: When shorted the power pads <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is low after relaese power pads back to 3.3v and fan spins again.is this normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: I asked what happens if you keep <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> tied to ground 4-5 seconds...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: oh sorry, as long as  <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> tied to ground , power drops and remain 0.01mv and fan stop when you release after 2,3 seconds it boots by itself. all this happen board out on the desk, connecting charger and usb mouse only. when it boots back on the machine it works fine and boot the osx and can shut down by osx or pressing the power button. but can't turn on again unless connect the charger and tuto boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: When the board is in the case, remove the keyboard and see if you can turn on with power pads; after shut it down from OSX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: once shutdown from the OSX, removed keyboard and tried to on with pads not working. only wayto turn on is reconnect the charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: Do you note a drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: Hi Info2 this is SOLVED. <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> was accurate. But as a last option i replaced <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR>. all good. Thank you again for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> shouldn't void power pads from MLB to work correctly.
I suppose <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> had leakage...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Can't turn on after shut down.
threads.message: Ok. Good to know that. But its hard to diagnose. Anyway thank you so much.
